name: water supply network construction | water supply network | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4202/documentation

This datasets represents the construction of a water distribution network in an average town, providing water to households and industries. The dataset is based on two sources. The first source is data from a CH company, which was also the basis for preceding versions of this dataset (v3.0 and below).  The second source is the “Anytown Water Distribution Network” distribution network model (http://emps.exeter.ac.uk/engineering/research/cws/resources/benchmarks/expansion/anytown.html), which is meant to represent a typical, generic medium-sized town transporting 5334 m3/day over a 69.53 km network. The Anytown model was used to update the data for cast iron (pipes) and to add reinforced concrete associated with two 591 m3 tanks. Life time of infrastructure is estimated at 70 years. Operation and maintenance of network is not considered and should be considered in the tap water production market dataset.

This activity starts with the excavation required to put in infrastructure.

This dataset ends at end of life of infrastructure. It includes materials (pipes with coating, tanks), excavation, and end-of-life disposal of infrastructure materials. Estimation for building process. Connectors to end-users, plumbing at end-users are excluded, as are brass and Zinc at end of life. No land use for construction work. Operation of infrastructure also excluded.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data provided by a CH company in Marin (NE).
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Cast iron and reinforced concrete : From Anytown. The other flows: From single data to Swiss situation, copied from an original dataset covering the geography CH. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Amounts for cast iron and reinforced concrete taken from the distribution network modelled with AnyTown (first published by Walski, T. M. (1987) and available on-line at http://emps.exeter.ac.uk/engineering/research/cws/resources/benchmarks/expansion/anytown.html). This model represents an average town formed around an old centre and a surrounding residential area, with some existing industries, and is used for economic simulation by hydraulic experts. The other flows are based on literature and estimations based on data from a single Swiss company.

exchanges.description: Literature value. Value taken from AnyTown - For tanks (reinforced conrete). It is calculated as 2% of the mass of concrete. This value of 2% represents average reinforcing steel content of structural concrete equipment in water treatment as estimated by an expert. AnyTown model was originally published by (Walski, T. M., 1987) and is available online at http://emps.exeter.ac.uk/engineering/research/cws/resources/benchmarks/expansion/anytown.html.
